trans-unit.source: How to configure Facebook authentication for your App Services application
trans-unit.target: How to configure Facebook authentication for your App Services application

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure Facebook authentication for your App Services application.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure Facebook authentication for your App Services application.

trans-unit.source: How to configure your App Service application to use Facebook login
trans-unit.target: How to configure your App Service application to use Facebook login

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to configure Azure App Service to use Facebook as an authentication provider.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to configure Azure App Service to use Facebook as an authentication provider.

trans-unit.source: To complete the procedure in this topic, you must have a Facebook account that has a verified email address and a mobile phone number.
trans-unit.target: To complete the procedure in this topic, you must have a Facebook account that has a verified email address and a mobile phone number.

trans-unit.source: To create a new Facebook account, go to [facebook.com].
trans-unit.target: To create a new Facebook account, go to [facebook.com].

trans-unit.source: This topic demonstrates use of the App Service Authentication / Authorization feature.
trans-unit.target: This topic demonstrates use of the App Service Authentication / Authorization feature.

trans-unit.source: This replaces the App Service gateway for most applications.
trans-unit.target: This replaces the App Service gateway for most applications.

trans-unit.source: Differences that apply to using the gateway are called out in notes throughout the topic.
trans-unit.target: Differences that apply to using the gateway are called out in notes throughout the topic.

trans-unit.source: Register your application with Facebook
trans-unit.target: Register your application with Facebook

trans-unit.source: Log on to the [Azure portal], and navigate to your application.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the [Azure portal], and navigate to your application.

trans-unit.source: Copy your **URL**.
trans-unit.target: Copy your **URL**.

trans-unit.source: You will use this to configure your Facebook app.
trans-unit.target: You will use this to configure your Facebook app.

trans-unit.source: In another browser window, navigate to the [Facebook Developers] website and sign-in with your Facebook account credentials.
trans-unit.target: In another browser window, navigate to the [Facebook Developers] website and sign-in with your Facebook account credentials.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) If you have not already registered, click **Apps** > **Register as a Developer**, then accept the policy and follow the registration steps.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) If you have not already registered, click **Apps** > **Register as a Developer**, then accept the policy and follow the registration steps.

trans-unit.source: Click **My Apps** > **Add a New App** > **Website** enter a unique name for your app, then click **Create New Facebook App ID**.
trans-unit.target: Click **My Apps** > **Add a New App** > **Website** enter a unique name for your app, then click **Create New Facebook App ID**.

trans-unit.source: Pick a category for your application from the dropdown, then click **Create App ID** and on the next page, click **Skip Quick Start**.
trans-unit.target: Pick a category for your application from the dropdown, then click **Create App ID** and on the next page, click **Skip Quick Start**.

trans-unit.source: This takes you to the developer dashboard for your application.
trans-unit.target: This takes you to the developer dashboard for your application.

trans-unit.source: On the **App Secret** field, click **Show**, provide your password if requested, then make a note of the values of **App ID** and **App Secret**.
trans-unit.target: On the **App Secret** field, click **Show**, provide your password if requested, then make a note of the values of **App ID** and **App Secret**.

trans-unit.source: You will configure your application to use these later.
trans-unit.target: You will configure your application to use these later.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] **Security Note**
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] **Security Note**

trans-unit.source: The app secret is an important security credential.
trans-unit.target: The app secret is an important security credential.

trans-unit.source: Do not share this secret with anyone or distribute it within a client application.
trans-unit.target: Do not share this secret with anyone or distribute it within a client application.

trans-unit.source: On the left navigation bar, click **Settings**, type the **URL** of your Mobile App in **App Domains**, and enter a **Contact Email**.
trans-unit.target: On the left navigation bar, click **Settings**, type the **URL** of your Mobile App in **App Domains**, and enter a **Contact Email**.

trans-unit.source: If you don't see a website section below, click **Add Platform** > **Website**, enter the **URL** of your Mobile App in the **Site URL** field, then click **Save Changes**.
trans-unit.target: If you don't see a website section below, click **Add Platform** > **Website**, enter the **URL** of your Mobile App in the **Site URL** field, then click **Save Changes**.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Advanced** tab, add your application's **Redirect URI** to **Valid OAuth redirect URIs**, then click **Save Changes**.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Advanced** tab, add your application's **Redirect URI** to **Valid OAuth redirect URIs**, then click **Save Changes**.

trans-unit.source: Your redirect URI is the URL of your application appended with the path, _/.auth/login/facebook/callback_.
trans-unit.target: Your redirect URI is the URL of your application appended with the path, _/.auth/login/facebook/callback_.

trans-unit.source: For example, `https://contoso.azurewebsites.net/.auth/login/facebook/callback`.
trans-unit.target: For example, `https://contoso.azurewebsites.net/.auth/login/facebook/callback`.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you are using the HTTPS scheme.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you are using the HTTPS scheme.

trans-unit.source: If you are using the App Service Gateway instead of the App Service Authentication / Authorization feature, your redirect URL instead uses the gateway URL with the _/signin-facebook_ path.
trans-unit.target: If you are using the App Service Gateway instead of the App Service Authentication / Authorization feature, your redirect URL instead uses the gateway URL with the _/signin-facebook_ path.

trans-unit.source: The Facebook account which was used to register the application is an administrator of the app.
trans-unit.target: The Facebook account which was used to register the application is an administrator of the app.

trans-unit.source: At this point, only administrators can sign into this application.
trans-unit.target: At this point, only administrators can sign into this application.

trans-unit.source: To authenticate other Facebook accounts, click **Status & Review** in the left navigation bar.
trans-unit.target: To authenticate other Facebook accounts, click **Status & Review** in the left navigation bar.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Yes** to enable general public access.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Yes** to enable general public access.

trans-unit.source: Add Facebook information to your application
trans-unit.target: Add Facebook information to your application

trans-unit.source: If using the App Service Gateway, ignore this section and instead navigate to your gateway in the portal.
trans-unit.target: If using the App Service Gateway, ignore this section and instead navigate to your gateway in the portal.

trans-unit.source: Select **Settings**, **Identity**, and then **Facebook**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Settings**, **Identity**, and then **Facebook**.

trans-unit.source: Paste in the values you obtained earlier and click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Paste in the values you obtained earlier and click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Back in the [Azure portal], navigate to your application.
trans-unit.target: Back in the [Azure portal], navigate to your application.

trans-unit.source: Click **Settings** > **Authentication/Authorization**, and make sure that **App Service Authentication** is **On**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Settings** > **Authentication/Authorization**, and make sure that **App Service Authentication** is **On**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Facebook**, paste in the App ID and App Secret values which you obtained previously, optionally enable any scopes needed by your application, then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Facebook**, paste in the App ID and App Secret values which you obtained previously, optionally enable any scopes needed by your application, then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: By default, App Service provides authentication but does not restrict authorized access to your site content and APIs.
trans-unit.target: By default, App Service provides authentication but does not restrict authorized access to your site content and APIs.

trans-unit.source: You must authorize users in your app code.
trans-unit.target: You must authorize users in your app code.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) To restrict access to your site to only users authenticated by Facebook, set **Action to take when request is not authenticated** to **Facebook**.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) To restrict access to your site to only users authenticated by Facebook, set **Action to take when request is not authenticated** to **Facebook**.

trans-unit.source: This requires that all requests be authenticated, and all unauthenticated requests are redirected to Facebook for authentication.
trans-unit.target: This requires that all requests be authenticated, and all unauthenticated requests are redirected to Facebook for authentication.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to use Facebook for authentication in your app.
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to use Facebook for authentication in your app.

trans-unit.source: Related Content
trans-unit.target: Related Content
